cards.title: Definitions and Graphs
details: Understand definitions of hyperbolic functions in terms of exponential functions
Sketch graphs of hyperbolic functions

cards.title: Identities and Inverse Hyperbolic Functions
details: Prove and use identities involving hyperbolic functions
Understand and use inverse hyperbolic functions, including logarithmic forms

cards.title: Systems of Equations and Consistency
details: Formulate and solve matrix equations representing systems of three linear equations
Understand cases of consistency and inconsistency, relate to singularity of the matrix
Interpret geometrically in terms of lines and planes

cards.title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
details: Understand characteristic equations, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors
Find eigenvalues and eigenvectors of 2x2 and 3x3 matrices with real, distinct eigenvalues

cards.title: Diagonalisation and Cayley-Hamilton Theorem
details: Express a matrix in the form QDQ^(-1) and use for calculations
Use the fact that a matrix satisfies its own characteristic equation

cards.title: Differentiation of Advanced Functions
details: Differentiate hyperbolic functions
Differentiate inverse trigonometric and inverse hyperbolic functions

cards.title: Implicit, Parametric, and Maclaurin Series
details: Obtain second derivatives for implicit and parametric functions
Derive and use the first few terms of a Maclaurin series

cards.title: Integration of Hyperbolic and Special Functions
details: Integrate hyperbolic functions
Recognise and integrate functions of the forms (a^2 - x^2)^(-1/2), (a^2 + x^2)^(-1/2), (x^2 + a^2)^(-1)
Use trigonometric or hyperbolic substitutions as appropriate

cards.title: Reduction Formulae and Approximations
details: Derive and use reduction formulae for definite integrals
Understand area approximations using rectangles, bounds, and inequalities

cards.title: Arc Length and Surface Area
details: Use integration to find arc lengths and surface areas of revolution in Cartesian and polar coordinates

cards.title: De Moivre’s Theorem and Multiple Angles
details: Understand and prove De Moivre’s theorem for integer exponents
Use De Moivre’s theorem for rational exponents and express trigonometric ratios of multiple angles

cards.title: Roots of Unity and Series Summation
details: Find and use nth roots of unity
Apply De Moivre’s theorem in the summation of series

cards.title: First Order Linear Equations
details: Find and use integrating factors for first order linear differential equations
Find general and particular solutions using initial conditions

cards.title: Second Order Linear Equations
details: Understand complementary function and particular integral for linear equations with constant coefficients
Find the complementary function for first or second order linear equations
Find a suitable particular integral for various types of right-hand sides

cards.title: Substitution and Modelling
details: Use substitution to reduce equations to linear or separable form
Interpret solutions in modelling contexts
